intro: Hypericum hircinum var. majus, commonly known as the greater St. John's wort, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces bright yellow flowers with five petals, which bloom in late summer. Its botanical characteristics include the presence of yellow-orange flowers and the ability to thrive in well-drained soils. It is often found in woodland edges, meadows, and rocky areas.
